nodes.text: Today, I shall see if you have learned how to solve the most difficult tool use problems. We will adjourn to the lock room where I'll call upon you one person at a time to crack the big safe.
I will be honored to volunteer to be the first to show you my mastery of rogue tools, sir.
I applaud your eagerness, Herr Sosi. However, first up will be Herr O'Conner. The rest of you will wait in the corridor until you are summoned.
Any questions or comments?
I stopped the Drat Invasion...
Indeed? How did you manage that achievement?
There was a Drat Queen who ordered the Drats to invade the castle...
I destroyed her and her minions. They will bother us no more.
I forced her to leave the castle and never return.
Very good, Herr O'Conner. You have proven yourself to be quite a hero...
Wait! How do you know that Conner isn't just lying about some mythical Drat Queen? Do you really believe that HE could be a hero?

I believe that anyone - with one minor exception - can be a hero, Herr Sosi. I believe that the truth of Herr O'Conner's statements can be verified by the noticeable lack of Drats in the school today.
So yes, Herr O'Conner, I congratulate you on ridding the castle of this dangerous menace.
Pardon me, Sir, but what should we be doing about the Dire Rats that have invaded the school?
The Warriors and the Paladins are supposedly dealing with the issue at the school. However, I expect every one of you to be capable of defending yourselves against the infernal creatures.
Furthermore, if a member of this class were to stop the Dire Rat invasion, it would impress many people at this school and infuriate one of them who believes that Rogues can do no good.
Any further questions?
What if one of us were to stop the Dire Rats from attacking the school?
If one of you uncovers a way to stop the invasion, then by all means do so. It would improve the reputation of Rogues and greatly annoy Mr. Terk.

options.text: Tell Master von Urwald About the Drat Queen

nodes.text: I heard a rumor that the Drat invasion was caused by the Queen Drat who lives in the dungeon below the school.
There is a dungeon below the castle, but it is extremely dangerous. I suggest you leave the heroics to someone else. It is not worth risking your life because of some stray rumor.
Sir, I will be honored to be the first person to show off my mastery of tool use, sir, yes sir!
Your eagerness, too, will be noted, Herr O'Conner.
Do you know anything about a 'Creepy' guy who has a room near the library?
Mr. Terk is the only staff member at this school that might be considered to be creepy, but his office is not near the library. So, no, I know nothing about such a person.
The trap on the safe we will be opening, it wouldn't happen to be painful, would it?
Yes, it is. However, I have complete faith that all of you have mastered trap disarming and will not find out how painful failure can be.
I hope that you will not disappoint me in your training.
No, sir, I'm sure that we will live up to your expectations.
If one of us managed to stop the Drat attacks, would that person become the 'Rogue of the Year'?
There are many factors in determining the Rogue of the Year but yes, Frulein, it would be a major point in your favor.
You will be no doubt be disappointed to learn that there is no class tomorrow. When we reconvene, we will discuss the upcoming 'Rogue of the Year' award.
Now it is time to put your abilities to the test. I will see you all shortly in the lock room.
Herr O'Conner, you may lead the way.

nodes.name: Safe Test
nodes.description: Bad news - it's time to crack a safe with Gerhard watching... Good news? No class tomorrow.
